fields.summary: Change ranking in planning board

fields.description: The overall story cannot be placed on top of its subtasks. The planning board thinks that an unrelated issue is the overall story for the subtasks.
fields.summary: Subtasks are separated from overall story in Planning Board

fields.description:
Right now, when you set up a visual indicator in the statistics, the bar only shows once.  I would like it to show every X so that you can see forward better.

For example:  Lets say I have set the Story Points Max value at 25.  I would like to see a Black bar every 25 points when looking at my backlog, so that I can see how far away a specific story is, given the current ranking and pointing.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like the statistics bar to repeat so that I can see 2 to 3 sprints ahead when doing release planning

fields.description:
COS:
- "Online Help" link uses help-paths.properties to direct the user to the correct version of documentation for the current version of GreenHopper
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user I would like to be directed to the GreenHopper documentation when I click "Help" under the Profile dropdown

fields.description:
COS:
- Same fields as [at present|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+your+Card+Styles]
- Configuration within the detailed card view itself (ask MJ) (with the intention of moving this out to a global template like page templates in Confluence)
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to configure the detail view for an issue

fields.description: There is currently an hour burndown chart and a statistics burndown chart but there is no wallboard capable issue burndown chart. I would like to have an easy to implement issue burndown chart for a wallboard. On my desktop monitors & dashboards, the agile gadget is fine for what I need. But for larger displays & wallboards an issue burndown is a requirement for me. Pretty please?
fields.summary: As a manager, i'd like a wallboard capable issue burndown chart

fields.description: I have found that the days remaining wallboard gadget uses excessive vertical space which causes you to be able to put fewer items on your wallboard. See attachment where there is approx 180px of empty space between the days remaining gadget and the activity stream gadget. It seems like 75px would be more than sufficient.
fields.summary: Days remaining wallboard gadget uses excessive vertical space

fields.description:
When I choose a wallboard capable gadget and it has any links, it renders them as blue on black, which are nearly unreadable

Here's the offending style block
{code}a:link,a:visited{color:#036;}a:hover,a:active{color:#369;}a:hover{text-decoration:none;}table{border-collapse:collapse;}.view .results-count a,.view .table-footer a{text-decoration:underline;}.view a,.view a:link,.view a:visited{color:#036;text-decoration:none;}.view a:hover,.view a:active{color:#369;text-decoration:underline;}{code}

Our reference to that css file is: http://tickets.turner.com/s/615/3/3.0.2/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite/com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.css

attaching screenshot of a link on the wallboard in my browser (mac: snow leopard, firefox 3.x)
fields.summary: Links on wallboard gadgets unreadable

fields.description: See Screenshot !Screen Shot 2011-07-27 at 2.09.49 PM.png!

fields.summary: User Picker Custom Field Not Configurable as Corner Field

fields.description: The agile gadget does not touch zero even though all issues are 'Closed' and the remaining time on each of them is Zero. The issue burndown is showing well. With this behavior we no longer can trust the gadget, which makes it unusable
fields.summary: Hour burndown chart does not touch zero

fields.description: Please see http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Statistics?focusedCommentId=249857920#comment-249857920
fields.summary: As GH user I'd like to set-up custom statistic based on existing JIRA issue fields

fields.description:
For instance:
- a Quick Action could be created to Resolve, Won't Fix and schedule in the current sprint. 
- a Quick Action could be used to move an issue to another project and assign to a different person.
fields.summary: As a GreenHopper user I would like Quick Action buttons where I can drag and drop issues to modify them
Create a JIRA 5.0 compatible branch of GreenHopper

fields.description: This causes log warnings from legend.vm
fields.summary: New issue types don't have a card colour assigned

fields.description:
Hi,

We are working with two week iterations/sprints and recently created dashboards with the Agile Gadget and people couldn't understand when they created filter-based Agile gadgets they had to set the start and end dates manually when the filter was something like 'sprint bugs' or 'sprint technical tasks'.

I assume GreenHopper follows the logic that if it's a filter, it can be anything, therefore it doesn't even attempt to determine a start and end date, but in this special case, it would be beneficial.

Kolos
fields.summary: As a user I'd like the a filter-based Agile Gadget to automatically set the start and/or end dates (for the charts) if the filter is based on one project and one version so that filter-based charts can be used to track the current sprint status.

fields.description:
Hello.

On Greenhopper, when looking at the Planning board, if there is an parent issue that is blocked, there will be a small yellow sign saying so. However subtasks have no such sign, making very hard for users, in this screen, to differentiate blocked issues from non-blocked issues. Currently, the only way is to go inside the issues in JIRA and see if they are blocked or not.

Are there any plans to fix/implement this behaviour?

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: On planning board, blocked subtasks have no icon to differentiate them from non-blocked

fields.description: Replacing deprecated code usage, OSUser in particular.
fields.summary: Clean up in preparation for JIRA 5.0

fields.description:
Currently a Sprint card (Sprint summary card on the right hand side in Planning board) contains at the bottom stuff like:
Time Estimate
Time Spent
Time Remaining
It will be very handy to see also how many working days is between Start&End dates so it is possible on the first glance to see if remaining time is doable within still available working days and known resources
We are running many projects at the same time and it is not very practicle to count every time how many working days is left
fields.summary: Sprint Days Remining info in Sprint card

fields.description:
Allow Rank reordering on the TaskBoard. I would like to be able to adjust the relative rank of my tasks. The rank should be contained within the column. If I have 3 tasks in the "ToDo" column. I would like to order them as A,B,C then be able to change it to C,A,B when task "C" 
needs to be done (moved to InProgress) prior to task "A".

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257364082
has a good discussion about this (but I could not find an enhancement or existing issue requesting the enhancement).
fields.summary: Allow Rank reordering on the Task Board

fields.description: This would be to avoid having to do something like a powerpoint presentation. Clicking a release/version and ask for "review slideshow" or something like that would be very helpful.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to drive my Agile reviews from a Release, with a full screen view of each story

fields.description:
At the moment, the RapidBoard works great for viewing issues across different projects. We are trying to use the board instead of the heavily used Task Board.

When trying to recreate our current boards, I found that there's currently no possibility to add a column with the same status, but other resolution. We currently use this feature to handle different outcomes in the process.

Would love to see this functionality coming in a next release!
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to configure a column based on a global status *and* resolution
As a user I would like to see the priority name when hovering over the priority icon

fields.description:
COS:
- Card colours
- ...more...
fields.summary: As a RB user I would like a smooth migration path from the Classic Mode so that my team can use it with minimal fuss

fields.description:
COS:
- Rapid View dropdown on the Rapid Board is sorted in alphabetical order
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like the rapid view DD to be sorted in alphabetical order to assist selection of my desired rapid view

fields.description:
When returning to a tab in Chrome that has the Rapid Board it takes a second to display the page (it is a blank tab for a second).

The scrolling on the page is also slow. Lagging by a few seconds. 

Further, drag and drop performance is poor, showing real lag when dragging to rank or transition.
fields.summary: Poor performance on the Rapid Board in Chrome (13, beta channel)

fields.description:
Full details, including steps to reproduce here:

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-5207
fields.summary: "Greenhopper Task Board" gadget does not render anything after saving configuration on IE8

fields.description:
Two known way to reproduce this:

*When there are no issues for a particular project in Agile and the grey bar in the Task Board is clicked*, the stack trace below is thrown:
{noformat}
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:324)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.boards.TaskBoard.getStepBoard(TaskBoard.java:240)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.TaskBoardAction.getSelectedStepBoard(TaskBoardAction.java:326)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.TaskBoardAction.doNavigator(TaskBoardAction.java:269)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.invokeCommand(ActionSupport.java:433)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:74)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
	at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
	at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
	at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:205)
	at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:143)
{noformat}

*When subtask is moved to Done and clicking on the cog icon for the parent task*, it will throws the same exception. Steps to reproduce:
# create a issue and subtask for the issue
# in the Classic Task Board, click on the "Hide Done Issue" . Refer to screenshot HideDoneIssue1.png
# move the subtask to "Done". 
# click on the Cog icon for the parent task. Refer to screenshot HideDoneIssue2.png
# exception thrown as in the HideDoneIssue3.png and stack trace in JIRA logs:
{code}
2012-11-29 22:47:14,474 http-8283-3 ERROR admin 1367x663x1 bxjv5c 127.0.0.1 /secure/GetTBCardMenu.jspa [com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager] MethodInvocationException occurred getting message body from Velocity: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -1
	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:324)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.boards.TaskBoard.getStepBoard(TaskBoard.java:240)
	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.TaskBoardAction.getSelectedStepBoard(TaskBoardAction.java:326)
...
{code}
(i) to fix this, in GreenHopper 6.0.x, click on the "Hide Done Issues" again. 

I believe that this error page should be handled gracefully to let users know that this is not a bug, but an error that no issues are created in the project yet.
fields.summary: Error Page Should Be Handled Gracefully When There Are No Issues in Task Board

fields.description: http://www.agileproductdesign.com/presentations/user_story_mapping/index.html

fields.description:
COS:
- ability to change which column is red, denoting work to do.
- ability to change which column is green, denoting work done.
- red - yellow - green order
- grey columns are not counted for statistics (ie CFD, Control Chart)
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to specify my Green/Yellow/Red columns for the creation of statistics on the Reporting tab

fields.description:
A Waste snake is a place on the scrum board where everyone can hang a "post-it" of everything that slows them down during the day

I know there are no gadgets for this, though gadgets can only be added to the dashboard as opposed to the task board anyway...

There is loads of room in the toolbar for another icon, have a cool snakes like icon, which when clicked either has a pop out list which comes in like to the right of the done column. One would have the options of keeping this open or not. Waste snake entries should be quick to add, I guess they could be a new JIRA issue type but that's overkill perhaps...
fields.summary: Task board - add waste snake

fields.description:
Currently the planning board allows filtering by version and component. It would be nice to be able to filter by (multiple) issue Types, e.g. to be able to now show bugs. 

This should be added in the url so a posted url could open the Planning board as desired.
fields.summary: Planning board - add Filtering on Issue Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-3278].
  {panel}

To reproduce:

1. Add Time Tracking and Log Work to the Default Screen, the Workflow Screen, and the Resolve Issue Screen.
2. Create a new issue, e.g., A-1.
3. Set its original estimate to any non-zero amount, e.g. 1h.
4. Create a filter, key = A-1, save it as A-1 Filter.
5. Create a dashboard, add the Agile Gadget, set its filter to A-1 Filter.
6. On the gadget's Info tab, set the date range so that it includes today.
7. Observe that the Info tab and the Hours tab report 1h remaining.
8. Resolve A-1. On the Resolve Issue Screen, set the remaining time to 0h.
9. Observe that the gadget's Info and the Hours tab report 0h remaining. This is what I expect so far.
10. Reopen the issue. On the Workflow Screen, set the remaining time to 3h.
11. Observe that the Info tab reports 3h remaining; observe that the Hours tab still incorrectly reports 0h remaining. I would expect that the Hours tab would report 3h remaining.

I originally raised this issue in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-80718
fields.summary: Agile Gadget Hours Chart shows more remaining hours than Info tab and underlying data show, after setting remaining time on reopen.

fields.description: As a project manager, I would like to see the actual release date in the "GH Days Remaining" gadget, so I know the work days left as well as the actual calendar date of the release.
fields.summary: Add actual release date to "Days Remaining" gadget

fields.description: When I try to modify the settings of an existing Progress Project gadget (the red-yellow-green bar for wallboards & dashboards) or the cumulative flow gadget, often the form is truncated, with part of the form below the display window. There is no scroll bar to see the rest of the options or submit. I usually have to either delete it and add a new one, or drag it around on the page till the whole form appears, change the values and submit, and drag it back to where it needs to be.
fields.summary: Whole form not shown when editing Progress Project or Cumulative Flow gadget on dashboard

fields.description: Screenshot attached from Chrome 13 on Mac
fields.summary: Incorrect tab in JIRA Administration is selected when on any of the GreenHopper configuration tabs ("Administration" tab instead of "Plugins")

fields.description: Link in the tools drop down to migrate to rapidView. link is only available if RapidBoard enabled. Show notification telling them whats going to happen. Ranking will change. No Highlight.
fields.summary: As an existing GH user I want to be able to migrate an existing context to a Rapid View

fields.description:
The GreenHopper task board is designed to replace a white board scrum board but we still need to have a physical scrum board for a couple of things, including a *Sprint Calendar*

A scrum/sprint calendar is a common things for any team doing SCRUM, typically teams uses Sprints of 2 to 4 weeks, within the particular Sprint there are a number of events to keep track of when they occur. 

As of now, GreenHopper has a Start Date, End Date and Release Date for every sprint, but they are not visible in an integrated Sprint Calendar.

Depending on the practitioner, the particulars of the calendar will change but will include dates like

* Daily standup time
* Date of feature freeze
* Date of Code freeze
* Demo date
* Product Backlog Planning Date
* Sprint Planning (part 1/2) Date
* Sprint retrospective date

Ideally a Sprint calendar would be integral to Greenhopper and be fully configurable with the milestone dates all present. This would then be vsiisble on a sidebar when the taskbar was in view.

A poor man's version would be an editable textbox which was not integrated to GreenHopper, which one could view with the task board opr even a poorer poor man's as a gadget for the dashboard would help.
fields.summary: Integrated Sprint Calendar

fields.description: When viewing issues as lists and showing sub-tasks, sub-tasks are not necessarily kept on the same page as the parent.  (See the attached screen shot).  I would like to suggest that it would be better to display sub-tasks on the same page as the parent, even if it means exceeding the number of issues to be displayed per page.  Either that or provide a toggle that allows for this limit to be exceeded when their are "orphaned" sub-tasks.  Thanks for considering this!
fields.summary: No orphan sub-tasks in list views
As a user I want to change the colours for the CFD

fields.description:
CFD gadget colours are currently different from Chart Board. These need to be the same default colours and also respect any changes the user makes to the colours via the Chart Board legend colour-picker.
Wallboard to use same colours too.
fields.summary: As a user I want the CFD gadget to use the same colours as the chart.

fields.description:
With Jira 4.3 and GH 5.6/5.6.3 when the field "Epic/Theme" = None (i.e. there is no value specified) for a specific issue, this field is removed altogether from View Issue screen. It is only displayed without values when all existing values are removed using the pop-up window. When the issue view screen is refreshed after that, the field is hidden.

Previously, in Jira 4.1.2 and GH 5.2.4, it was still displayed in View Issue screen with the small edit icon next to it. Clicking on it displayed a pop-up window and values could be added easily.

Steps to reproduce this behavior:

*JIRA 4.3 & GreenHopper 5.6* and *JIRA 4.3.3 & GreenHopper 5.6.4*:
1. Choose a project to test this on and make sure Epic/Theme custom field is configured properly for this project (Administration -> Custom Fields, Administration -> Field Configurations, Administration -> Field Configuration Schemes):
1.1 It has to be included on the correct screen(s)
1.2 Field Configuration Scheme is valid - correct issue type is mapped to correct Field Configuration
1.3 the field is not hidden in the Field Configuration
2. Click Create Issue link in the top left area in Jira
3. Choose the correctly configured project and issue type, click Next
4. Fill in mandatory fields (do not insert a value to Epic/Theme field) and click Create
5. Notice that there is no Epic/Theme field visible in Issue View screen
6. Click Edit, insert a value into Epic/Theme field, click Update
7. Notice that Epic/Theme field is now visible in View Issue screen with the inserted value
8. Click the small pencil icon next to the value in Epic/Theme field
9. In the appeared popup remove all values from this field and click Update
10. Notice the Epic/Theme field is still visible in View Issue screen and 'None' is denoted as its value
11. Refresh the browser
12. Notice that the Epic/Theme field has now disappeared from the View Issue screen

*JIRA 4.1.2 & GreenHopper 5.2.4*:
1. Choose a project to test this on and make sure Epic/Theme custom field is configured properly for this project (Administration -> Custom Fields, Administration -> Field Configurations, Administration -> Field Configuration Schemes):
1.1 It has to be included on the correct screen(s)
1.2 Field Configuration Scheme is valid - correct issue type is mapped to correct Field Configuration
1.3 the field is not hidden in the Field Configuration
2. Click Create Issue link in the top left area in Jira
3. Choose the correctly configured project and issue type, click Next
4. Fill in mandatory fields (do not insert a value to Epic/Theme field) and click Create
5. Notice that the Epic/Theme field *IS* visible (without a value) in Issue View screen and there is a small pencil icon next to it (see the screenshot).

It would make it much easier for the users to add values to Epic/Theme field when the behavior from JIRA 4.1.2 & GH 5.2.4 would be brought back. Can this be done?
fields.summary: As a user I would like to see Epic/Theme field in Issue View screen even when there is no value inserted

fields.description: When we type Chinese characters in JIRA Agile (as attached file screenshot_01.jpg), after typing "Enter", those Chinese characters will turn into wrong encoding characters(as attached file screenshot_02.jpg ). In addition, wrong encoding character issue happens in JQL directly (as attached file screenshot_03.jpg). We cannot filter with issues that we need until we manually change chinese words (as attached file screenshot_04.jpg ).
fields.summary: Chinese Characters turned into wrong encoding characters

[JQuery UI] IE9 Card Styles Configuration Card view corner field's select drop down is too wide

fields.description:
The burndown gadget does not seem to show the real-time values based on the burndown chart.

Here is the current sample of the burndown chart:
!Screen-01.jpg|thumbnail!

And here is the current burndown gadget:
!Screen-02.jpg|thumbnail!

Currently, it does not reflect today's logged work.
fields.summary: Burndown Gadget to Show Real-Time Burndowns

fields.description:
COS: 
- No create rapid view message
- No rapid board browsing if user doesn't have BROWSE_ISSUE permission
fields.summary: As an anonymous user I want the UI to make more sense

fields.description:
// workaround for https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-661
344        return location.replace("/2/_", "/" + BuildProperties.getVersion() + "/_");
fields.summary: Cleanup fix for WebResourceManager uses wrong value for plugin version

fields.description:
COS:
- tab through to this field as you do on the Summary and Description field
- enter or tab to save
- esc to cancel
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to inline edit a statistic field (number custom field) on the detailed card view

fields.description:
COS:
- Story Points is a custom number field that GreenHopper creates, focus on this
- This statistic will be used for column constraints
- This statistic will be displayed in the card
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to select a custom number field as the statistic for my Rapid View

fields.description: See linked bug
fields.summary: As a user of the RapidBoard I want JIRA issue screen configuration to be taken into account (e.g. don't show priority if field is hidden)

fields.description:
COS
- Option "Create Rapid View" in the Views DD of the Issue Navigator
- When clicked the user is taken to the Rapid Board with a temporary Rapid View
- The temporary Rapid View includes a column for each status currently in use, based upon the workflow
- Option to Save the temporary Rapid View is provided at the top where the Configure link usually lives if they are an Admin
- Save option on Rapid View takes the user to the Manage Rapid Views page with the name field highlighted
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to Create a Rapid View from the Views drop down on the Issue Navigator

fields.description:
Create a new dashboard and add an Issue Statistics gadget. Choose a project that is GH enabled. The list offered for Statistic Type does not include Story Points. 

This is because the default searcher for this field, Number Searcher, doesn't implement the CustomFieldStattable interface. Please could you provide a searcher that offers statistics for this field.
fields.summary: Story Points field not an option in Issue Statistics gadget

fields.description:
Currently the fixVersion synchronizer will run when triggered by the following JIRA events:

* Issue Created
* Issue Reopened
* Issue Moved
* Issue Updated

If a user wants to use a custom event in their workflow, then they won't be able to trigger these synchronizers as part of that workflow, without using one of these events, and as the workflows only allow one event to be triggered, users are stuck with the choice of using one feature or another.

If we could allow the synchronizer listeners to be triggered by user-configurable events, then users could have their cake and eat it too.
fields.summary: Allow FixVersion Synchronizer listener to be triggered by custom events

fields.description:
COS:
 - assign to existing unreleased fix versions
  - option to release once assigned
  - select existing fix version for one or more projects (depending on issues in the view)
- Notification to explain what occurred
- Ability to release into different unreleased fix versions in their respective projects
fields.summary: As a user I would like to release the issues in my done column into an existing fix version on the Agile Board

fields.description: When viewing Epics in the Planning Board and adjusting their priorities up and down, this does nothing to the priorities of the related children of the Epics. The Epic could be moved to the top of the heap, but the children could still remain at the bottom. This seems inconsistent. Any reordering of the Epics would then call for another manual reordering of the children. It makes Epics very unusable.
fields.summary: Prioritization of Epics should also prioritize the children issues

fields.description:
When issues are highlighted, I'd like to see a sum count of the issues.

Even better, you could also break down the totals specific to each board.  For the task board, each column could should the sum total highlighted.
fields.summary: Provide a sum total of issues highlighted on boards

fields.description: For instance, at present it selects the parent version which has no release date set (cause we don't yet know when we release). Instead, it should select the child version that has a release date.
fields.summary: As a user I would like the Days Remaining Gadget to cascade down and select a release date that does exist, even if it is within a child version

fields.description:
GreenHopper does not yet support a custom field coming from a third party plugin. The GreenHopper mechanism for fields is based on the JIRA field type, classes like TextCTF. We will need to create a GreenHopper template for each type.

For example:
We would like to make the BillingKey field from the Tempo Plugin mandatory to prevent broken work log entries. However when trying to create an issue using the Card view in GreenHopper the drop down for BillingKey does not appear, just its label with an asterisk marking it as mandatory.

Not being able to create issues in CardView takes a lot of the streamlining away that GreenHopper gives us.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to add a custom field from a third party JIRA plugin to my card

fields.description:
As project manager, I'd like to customize the progress bar to show the progress in term of story points not cards count
The progress bar is displayed on multiple places
1. At the top of the taskboard
2. At the top of each fix version in planning board
3. In the project progress gadget
fields.summary: As project manager, I'd like to customize the progress bar to show the progress in term of story points not cards count

fields.description:
We are in the process of migrating from another system to Jira. We currently using a bubblejet printer to print stories directly onto 3x5 index cards.

With the current Greenhopper printing functionality, we can't print one card per page and therefore can't print directly onto cards.

We would like the ability print one card per page with the card layout sized to fit well on a 3x5 index card
fields.summary: Ability to print on standard index cards

fields.description: As a Lean Agile PM, I want a view option to see the Cumulative Flow Chart as a stacked area chart (not just layered area chart), so that I can see cycle times and how they are changing.
fields.summary: Cumulative flow chart should have stacked-area view

fields.description:
It would be great to be able to set recurring non-working days (e.g. annual public holidays such as 26th January in Australia).  
A check box for the date to set it as an annual date would be sufficient.  Once set the date would never be considered a working day ever again.
As many countries have annually recurring non-working days, this feature would be beneficial to many.

Also, it would be nice to be able to enter the dates in as text, rather than having to click forward through months every new date as the user adds dates further and further away into the future.
fields.summary: Allow Non-working days to be set as recurring

fields.description:
Once a date has been select for either Start Date, End Date, or Release Date, you cannot remove the date and return it to an empty value.

There should be a way to remove the date.

Workaround:
For End Date and Release Date
Directly edit the database and update the {{releasedate}} column within the project version table.
fields.summary: Ability to remove version start, end, release dates

fields.description:
In order to avoid the creation of many contexts and facilitate the usability of both planning boards and task boards, I'd like to have the  possibility to filter the different issue types, with checkboxes on the legend bar. (cf. picture attached). Of course, t
his feature should not remove the possibility to create issues from the legend (as this feature is enjoyable too :).
fields.summary: As GH user, I'd like to be able to quickly filter issue types from the legend (with a checkbox for example).
Bug. Unchanged default value of Auto Assign in Assignee field gives error

fields.description:
1. type 2 characters in reporter field
2. delete characters
3. tab away from field
= value of field is from the list despite not choosing it
fields.summary: Bug: Reporter field value is the top type-ahead value when deleting field contents and tabbing away
Bug: Empty mandatory reporter field does not give error and allows submit. Resulting value is Anonymous.
Bug: Assignee should be marked as mandatory if is a required field

fields.description:
The GreenHopper plugin should support time management without requiring work to be logged. This is a common Scrum practice and has resulted in the time management feature being modified recently in JIRA 4.2.

Explanation:
With GreenHopper, I may presently add the field "Remaining" to the Card View. This field, however, is calculated and requires that the "Time Spent" be entered in order to perform the calculation. Many practitioners of Scrum specifically avoid tracking "Time Spent" and focus strictly on how much time is required to complete work on a story. This is useful where one is more interested in looking forward and not so much in looking backward.

In JIRA 4.2 one may directly enter a value for "Remaining Estimate" without entering a value for "Time Spent". This cannot presently be done directly on the Card View (in the Planning Board) as the field "Remaining Estimate" cannot be added to this view. This forces one to "View the issue in JIRA" and then "Edit the issue in JIRA" in order to update the value for "Remaining Estimate" and then close both of these to return to the Planning Board and then see the updated value in the "Remaining" field. Ouch!

From the JIRA 4.2 Release Notes:

Time Tracking Changes

Prior to JIRA 4.2, the Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate fields could not be edited independently and their values would be synchronised after logging work.

From JIRA 4.2, time tracking is more flexible. The values in these fields are not tied to each other and they can be edited independently. Additionally, it is now possible to change the Original Estimate value after work has been logged.


References: 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13733 
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+4.2+Release+Notes
fields.summary: Please allow for the "editable" Remaining Estimate field to be added to a card on the Planning Board (now available since JIRA 4.2)

fields.description: At present, the marker is by project.  When there are multiple teams working on a project, if one team adjusts the marker based on their story points, the other team(s) cannot set their own marker(s) unless they change the existing marker and that impacts the first team's established marker.
fields.summary: Would like the ability to add markers by Team within a Project
As a GH User I would like the Assignee drop down on the Planning Board and Task Board to be autocomplete like the assignee field on a card, as this will improve performance
As a GH User I would like the Assignee and Reporter fields on the New Card dialog to be the new shiny autocomplete to improve performance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-2895].
  {panel}

The Statistics Burndown Chart has way too many points when viewing a release version daily that spans many months.
I have attached a screenshot of burndown chart by story points for our 2.4.0 release.
You can see that the graph has a point for each day and is hard to read.

I have attached a burndown chart by story points for a two week sprint and the chart has fewer points as the period is shorter.

Could we choose a different period to display the points for a release burndown (maybe weekly and monthly)?
fields.summary: The Statistics Burndown Chart is too granular for a release duration greater then a few months.

fields.description:
We give our engineers the flexibility of adding sub-tasks to their stories during a Sprint. From the Scrumaster's perspective we want to track Issue Burndown just at the story level. 

Currently we create Contexts to achieve this, but it would be nice if there was an option on chartboard after selecting "Issue Burndown" to specify the Issue Type(s) that you wanted included.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I want to be able to easily select which issue types (without creating Contexts) to chart when viewing the Issue Burndown chart, so that I can differentiate Burndown of Stories vs. Tasks vs. etc.

fields.description:
On the planning board, only fixed 'counters' are used.
Todo / In Progress / Done / Resolved / Unresolved.

This isn't very flexible if you are working with your own (extra) states.
It would be an improvement if Greenhopper would take the states from the project workflow ,so that additional states show up here also. (and states not defined in your workflow would not be shown)

See screenshot for the 'counters' mentioned.
fields.summary: Make Planning board counters configurable or dependent on workflow states

fields.description:
If you define your own states and columns in the taskboard view Greenhopper shows the following behaviour for the coloured bars showing the 'state'of the current sprint,
Stories in the first column are counted as 'red'.
Stories last column are counted as 'green'.
The rest of the stories are counted as 'yellow'.
This fixed behaviour isn't very flexible if you are working with your own (extra) states. 

It would be an improvement if you could.
a) specify which columns are mapped to each of the 3 existing colours (red, yellow, green)
b) maybe even add extra colors to differentiate issues even further.

See screenshot attached for examples of the 'coloured bars' in question.
fields.summary: Make Greenhopper colour bars configurable

fields.description: I'd like to be able to drop a story onto an epic in the planning view to link that story to the epic.
fields.summary: Drag and drop story over an epic to create association

fields.description: In the planning view, when sorted by Epic/Theme, I'd like to see stories linked to an epic indented under that epic as sub-tasks are currently displayed under a task.
fields.summary: In planning view, format Epic/Stories like Issue/Sub-task

fields.description:
Statistic bar will calculate and include parent issue time remaining but will not be shown above the statistic bar in GreenHopper Plannning board if the parent issue have sub-task that consist of time remaining which will exceed the capacity of the statistic bar. 

Steps to replicate:
* create 3 issues with original estimate set to 2 days each
* create a subtask for each of the parent with original estimate set to 2 days
* put a statistic/capacity bar for time remaining with the value 10 days

!screenshot1.png!
GH will only show 4 issues placed above the bar but the total time remaining calculated is 10 days (which include Parent 3 time remaining).

!screenshot2.png!
if changed the statistic bar value to 8 days, the bar stay at the same place but this time, the total is correct which is 8 days for 4 issues.

GreenHopper view can't separate parent issue from its subtasks in the UI.
fields.summary: Statistic bar not include parent issue above the bar if its subtask exceed the value

fields.description:
is there a way to sort the stories with multiple field names.
i have two custom fields named StorySeverity and Sequence i want to order the stories like 

list by Priority, 
plus then by StorySeverity, 
plus then by Sequence. 

The idea is to be able to put 20+ items in a specific order using those fields.
fields.summary: CLONE - As a GH user I would like to be able to view my Issues sorted by multiple fields.

fields.description:
The legend color of CFD between the gadget ones and Chart or released board doesn't match.
How to make the color legend gadget be consistent with the CFD in Chart and released board?

Or better, how to customize them ?
In http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Cumulative+Flow+Chart
To do = orange
WIP = blue green
Done  = Violet
Closed = Green (it's what I observe in my GH)

In CFD Gadget, it's
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Cumulative+Flow+Chart+Gadget

To do = fuschia
WIP = Blue
Done = orange

Most annoying is orange that means completely 2 opposite status.


Thanks!
fields.summary: As Project Manager, CFD colours must be consistent across all reports page and gadgets (1 status column = 1 same colour) to avoid confusion

fields.description: In hours burndown graphs, "Accuracy" is being computed as "Time Spent" + "Estimated Time Remaining".  In our group, bugs get filed and added to releases during development, thus "original estimate" will grow throughout development.  Seeing how the original estimate grew, and how the "accuracy" line related to the original estimate line as a function of time would really help us identify feature creep and bad planning (e.g. we really blew our hours estimate right around the time Bob tried to fix this issue a week before release)!
fields.summary: Add "Original Estimate" as a standard available plot on "hours burndown chart"

fields.description:
it happened already several times that we worked on a project configuration for Greenhopper and have already spent a huge amount of hours for an individual customization of the project. And now we want to share this good configuration experience with other projects but can't. 

It would be very helpfull to copy project configuration to another project or reuse it to generate a new project template.
fields.summary: Derive from a configured project a project template / OR / copy a project configuration from another project (reuse)

fields.description:
You tend to only work on 1 project at a time, but yet you can raise issues on many projects.  I find it frustrating (and time consuming) that every time I create an issue against another project, my active project gets changed to that project.  

This is particularly annoying with regards to greenhopper, as the next time I go to the task board to get the next issue I need to work on, I get taken to the task board of the other project (which usually takes forever just to tell me that it can't display)
fields.summary: Creating an Issue should not change my active project

fields.description:
When adding a master Version via the GH add (version) dialog the version summary panel appears to be positioned with respect to other master version via the alpha-numeric sort on the version name,

When adding a child version (sprint) under the master version the new version appears at the top of the previously added child versions. As most sites would add sprints sequentially (sprint 1, sprint2,...) it would appear to be more useful if the child version appeared below pervious versions (as it did in older 4.x GH releases)

The current order requires much tedious use of the arrows in JIRA Manage Versions screen

This might be especially relevent if GH 6.0 is seperating the "sprints" from JIRA "versions" and there is work in that area.

*Workaround*

You should find the correct order if you put in an end date and release date in the future for the next child sprint. The ordering is determined by dates, and it does get confused when there are no dates there with the result that it falls back to the JIRA Version order.
fields.summary: Child Versions are added in "reverse" order within the Parent version

fields.description:
Per the ticket JSP-73951, GreenHopper presents the ranking number in scientific notation in the XML.

To reproduce, open this link:
http://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+GreenHopper+and+fixVersion+is+EMPTY+ORDER++BY+%22Backlog+Order%22+asc&tempMax=200
fields.summary: Backlog order is in scientific notation in XML

fields.description:
I believe that GH should implement a top-level team concept. Having multiple teams pull from a single project right now is cumbersome. (See: http://jaibeermalik.wordpress.com/2010/07/22/using-greenhopper-to-manage-multiple-teams-in-agile/) This should not require custom setup to achieve. And it is frustrating our adoption. 

Having separate project per team does not work either, as then there would have to be a separate "bug project" where issues could be reported but not associated with a team. Howver, then the coordination between what bug is in which project would be a nightmare. Enabling multiple teams within a single project, just like VersionOne and Rally is the right way to go.
fields.summary: Enable "Teams" as top-level concept

fields.description:
As a Greenhopper user, I expect a keyboard shortcut for saving an inline edit to an issue card, so that I can save small edits much more quickly than is possible using the mouse.

NOTE: the only way to save an inline edit to a Greenhopper card is to move the right hand from the keyboard to the mouse, carefully move the cursor over the small tick-mark to the right of the edited field, and click on the small tick icon while avoiding the small "x" icon.

NOTE: The "Alt+s" form submission shortcut does not work, because the in-line edits do not pop up a form (unlike "Edit Issue"), and "Return" just inserts a newline.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to save an inline edit to a card

fields.description: If at all possible, could you add a printable "Burndown" chart within GreenHopper so that we can visually track our daily progress?  I have attached a sample Excel worksheet that I use as a ScrumMaster for our daily standup meetings.  The formulas are very simple.  This would greatly save us time in having to manually enter the values from Jira into an external worksheet.  If you need any information, please feel free to contact me.  (806) 354-4106.
fields.summary: Add a "printable" Burndown Chart for releases/versions

fields.description: Per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Working+with+Epics, I have to go through a convoluted process to see or edit the relationship between user stories and epics. This should be a first class UI feature, just like issue linking, so that it is manipulatable through the issue editing UI or viewable directly in the issue's page.
fields.summary: Users can associate user stories with epics, and see these relationships, through the issue editing interface.

fields.description:
When saving a context for the TaskBoard, would like to be able to specify which columns are displayed for that context.

For example:  

Context 1: only show "To Do" & "In Progress" columns

Context 2: show all columns (i.e. "To Do", "In Progress", "Done")
fields.summary: Allow users to pick which columns will show in a TaskBoard context

fields.description: It doesn't' seem like I need to see the entire assignable users here. If someone doesn't have any issues assigned to them, I don't need to select them from the drop-down. With well over 100 assignable users, this would be a real time saver for us.
fields.summary: Filter the All Assignees drop-down on the Task Board to show only names of people who have issues assigned to them on the current Task Board

fields.description:
We have well over 100 assignable users so it's a giant PITA to find the one you need in the middle of the list. On the Assign To... drop-down on GH cards and in JIRA assignee drop-downs, I can type the first letter of the person's name and it will jump to the first user whose names starts with that letter. 

But that doesn't work for the All Assignees drop-down at the top of the Task Board. It would be great if it did.
fields.summary: Ability to traverse the All Assignees dropdown on the Task Board with the keyboard

fields.description: We'd like the option to show the red flag icon that indicates that an issue has exceeded its original time estimate on cards in all card views, similar to the "Blocked" icon.
fields.summary: Add the option to display the "Over Original Estimate" flag on cards

fields.description:
GreenHopper is an insanely useful tool - to the point where I have used it for various management reporting and tracking tasks that are outside of its immedaite Agile remit.

The specific need I have is to have issues that belong to Released versions remain visible. I have currently worked around this by adding new "virtual" or "logical" versions (which are unreleased and ordered after all "real" versions) to the system and then use the standard JIRA Multi-Select field to add this special version to the issue in addition to other "real" versions and sprints.

This technically works quite well, and even had the added benefit of showing little green ticks when the issue is released in a "real" version. The list view still shows the "real" versions as in a multi-select scenario, GreenHopper shows the earliest version by version order.

However, we have found that this approach breaks in a number of scenarios that have ultimately made the workaround unusable for us. The problems are:
a) The in-line editing has no idea about the multi-selects, and changing a fixVersion removes ALL other selected versions - so we had to stop using this;
b) You can't tell the JIRA issue "Bulk Edit" feature not to touch certain version; reducing its functionality considerably; amd
c) The subtleties of the workaround is beyond our general user community and is causing confusion and information loss.

I can easily store the virtual "version" grouping information using many other techniques; however I am left with the problem of how to get the issues visible on the GreenHopper Planning (or Task) board.

My suggestion is to simply add a check-box to the "Manage/Edit Context" facility where you can select "Releeased issues remain visible"

This should default to OFF (the existing behaviour) and it is appropraite for the override to be available against specific Contexts that need it.

NOTE: GHS-945 covers off a much more significant rework of how fixVersions work in GreenHopper. It is possible that some of the solution being developed there (apparently scheduled for GreenHopper 6.0) could solve this problems - but it possibly still may not. I am therefore adding this as a separate issue so that:
a) It doesn't totally feature-creep GHS-945, and
b) It can possibly be implemented more simply and sooner as it has a much lower impact and development footprint.
fields.summary: Override "Issues of Released Versions are hidden" behaviour

fields.description: It'd be nice to show that message when the form loads instead of having to submit it only to find out that GH isn't licensed.
fields.summary: Show "GreenHopper is not licensed" before the form is submitted for the Agile Gadget

fields.description:
Currently we can manually modify the capacity used to separate the stories which are 'above the line', and which are 'below the line'.
It would be good that this capacity figure is calculated from the 'ideal path' - the red guideline on the graph board, as this would
reflect remaining capacity.
fields.summary: The capacity 'line' on the planning board should reflect (optionally) the remaining capacity of the sprint.
Make JIRA Software iPad/touch friendly
